010package imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.nonlinear;
011
012import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014import imagingbook.pub.geometry.mappings.Mapping2D;
015
016/**
017 * A non-linear mapping that produces a spherical distortion.
018 * The transformation is implicitly inverted, i.e., maps target to source image
019 * coordinates.
020 * Note: This class has been deprecated and substituted by an ImageJ plugin.
021 * 
022 * @author WB
023 */
024@Deprecated
025public class SphereMapping implements Mapping2D {
026        
027        static double DefaultRefIdx = 1.8;
028                        
029        private final double xc;                        // center of sphere
030        private final double yc;
031        private final double rmax;                      // radius of sphere
032        private final double rho;                       // refraction index
033   
034        public SphereMapping(double xc, double yc, double rmax) {
035                this(xc, yc, rmax, DefaultRefIdx);
036        }
037        
038        public SphereMapping(double xc, double yc, double rad, double rho) {
039                this.xc = xc;
040                this.yc = yc;
041                this.rmax = rad;
042                this.rho = rho;
043        }
044
045        @Override
046        public Pnt2d applyTo(Pnt2d pnt) {
047                final double x = pnt.getX();
048                final double y = pnt.getY();
049                double dx = x - xc;
050                double dy = y - yc;
051                double dx2 = dx * dx;
052                double dy2 = dy * dy;
053                double rad2 = rmax * rmax;
054
055                double r2 = dx * dx + dy * dy;
056
057                if (r2 > 0 && r2 < rad2) {
058                        double z2 = rad2 - r2;
059                        double z = Math.sqrt(z2);
060
061                        double xAlpha = Math.asin(dx / Math.sqrt(dx2 + z2));
062                        double xBeta = xAlpha - xAlpha * (1 / rho);
063                        double x1 = x - z * Math.tan(xBeta);
064
065                        double yAlpha = Math.asin(dy / Math.sqrt(dy2 + z2));
066                        double yBeta = yAlpha - yAlpha * (1 / rho);
067                        double y1 = y - z * Math.tan(yBeta);
068                        return PntDouble.from(x1, y1);
069                }
070                else { // otherwise leave point unchanged
071                        return PntDouble.from(x, y);
072                }
073        }
074}
075
